TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AnimationClock extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock

Docs.summary: Maintains the run-time state of an and processes its output values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> objects are generated from <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> objects. An <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> describes an animation's output values, duration, begin time, end time, and other fundamental animation information. An <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> processes the animation values described by an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline animation) cil managed

Docs.param: The animation that describes this clock's output values and timing behaviors.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public object GetCurrentValue (object defaultOriginValue, object defaultDestinationValue);
.method public hidebysig instance object GetCurrentValue(object defaultOriginValue, object defaultDestinationValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The origin value provided to the clock if its animation does not have its own start value. If this clock is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous clock in the chain

The destination value provided to the clock if its animation does not have its own destination value. If this clock is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous clock in the chain
Docs.summary: Gets the current output value of the .
Gets the that describes this clock's behavior.
Docs.value: The animation that describes this clock's behavior.
